Hankcy, G.C.B........................Secretary.Arrived as Meeting was adjourning. -CTtiis; Document is- - ^Q^^opgrt:^'"' pr; His -Brifeannio*^IvEjesyy^T 0o ve government'nt".''). i,-','-CABINET 54 (24).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the Cabinet,held in the Prime Minister1s Room, Houseof Commons, S.W, 1, on WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER8th, 1924, at 11-30 p.m.After the conclusion of the Debate in theHouse of Commons on the "Workers1 Weekly" prosecution,!the Cabinet met for a few minutes and took note ofthe Prime Minister's intention to see the King at10 a.nu on the following morning, in order to askfoxa a dissolution.It was arranged to meet on the following morning at 11 a.KUTHE POLITICALSITUATION.The "Workers1 'Weekly" Debate.. previous reference:Cabinet 53(24).2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1October 9, 1924.
